title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0033

segments.en: And today we have another great elementary lesson for you all.
segments.cn: 今天我们为大家准备了另一节很棒的初级课程。

segments.en: That's right, we've got a lesson for all you sports fans out there.
segments.cn: 没错，我们为所有运动迷准备了一节课。

segments.en: Right, we're doing a podcast on sports today.
segments.cn: 对，我们今天做一个关于运动的播客。

segments.en: So we've got lots of language about basketball and sports in this lesson today.
segments.cn: 所以今天的课程中有很多关于篮球和运动的语言。

segments.en: Great, so let's take a look at our vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 很好，让我们看看我们的词汇预览。

segments.en: Basically it's an action in a game that is not allowed.
segments.cn: 基本上是在比赛中不允许的行为。

segments.en: Right, so if you're playing basketball and you kick the other player.
segments.cn: 对，如果你在打篮球时踢了对方球员。

segments.en: Yeah, if you're playing soccer and you pick up the ball.
segments.cn: 是的，如果你在踢足球时捡起了球。
我们的第二个单词是裁判。

segments.en: Right, so a referee is basically like the judge of a game.
segments.cn: 对，裁判基本上就像比赛的法官。

segments.en: So he's the one that will say that was a foul.
We're going to hear them in our dialogue.
segments.cn: 我们将在对话中听到它们。

segments.en: And we're going to be listening to two guys who are watching a basketball game on TV.
segments.cn: 我们将听到两个正在看篮球比赛的家伙。

segments.en: Hey, has the game started yet?
Don't worry, Shaq always screws up free throws.
Yeah, that was a great shot.
Can't believe he didn't see that.
Okay, end of the first quarter.
Alright, I'm going to make a beer run.
Alright, a really common situation whenever you're watching games with friends, right?
segments.cn: 好吧，这在和朋友看比赛时是个很常见的情况，对吧？

segments.en: You need to get a beer.
We'll talk about that in a little while.
Let's take a look at language takeaway.
Okay, let's take a look at our first word on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们看看语言要点中的第一个单词。

segments.en: This one's a bit hard to say, isn't it?
It's a little bit hard to explain, but if you're playing basketball and if someone fouls you, you get a free throw.
segments.cn: 这有点难解释，但如果你在打篮球时被犯规，你会得到一个罚球。

segments.en: So that's when all the players line up around you and you can throw the ball.
segments.cn: 所以那是所有球员围着你排队，你可以投球。

segments.en: To the basket without anyone blocking you or anything.
segments.cn: 投向篮筐，没有人阻挡你。

segments.en: A little bit complicated, but I'm sure the basketball fans understand what a free throw is.
segments.cn: 有点复杂，但我相信篮球迷知道罚球是什么。

segments.en: Alright, our next word is... Make the shot.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们下一个单词是... 投中。

segments.en: Let's listen to some examples and we'll understand the meaning of make the shot.
segments.cn: 让我们听一些例子，理解“投中”的意思。

segments.en: He made the shot from the other side of the court.
segments.cn: 他从场地另一边投中了。

segments.en: There's no way he's going to make that shot.
segments.cn: 他绝对不可能投中那个。

segments.en: He's way too far away from the net.
If Gretzky makes this shot, they're going to win the Stanley Cup.
segments.cn: 如果Gretzky投中这个，他们就会赢得斯坦利杯。

segments.en: To make the shot is to successfully put the ball in the basket.
segments.cn: 投中就是成功把球放进篮筐。

segments.en: You can use this expression in other sports as well, right?
segments.cn: 你也可以在其他运动中使用这个表达，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, you can use it in hockey to make the shot.
segments.cn: 是的，你可以在冰球中使用“投中”。

segments.en: You can also use it in golf.
segments.cn: 你也可以在高尔夫中使用。

segments.en: In a lot of different sports, they use the term to shoot.
segments.cn: 在很多不同的运动中，他们使用“投球”这个术语。

segments.en: So anytime you shoot the ball, you can make the shot.
segments.cn: 所以每当你投球时，你都可以说“投中”。

segments.en: Ok, our next word today... 3 pointer.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们的下一个单词... 三分球。

segments.en: It's a shot in basketball when you get 3 points.
segments.cn: 这是篮球中得3分的投篮。

segments.en: Usually this shot is taken from further out.
segments.cn: 通常这个投篮是从更远的地方投的。

segments.en: Yeah, so it's a little bit more difficult to make this shot.
segments.cn: 是的，所以这个投篮有点难。

segments.en: You know, sometimes people might say a 3-point shot or something like that, but our EnglishPod learners, they know.
segments.cn: 你知道，有时人们可能会说三分投篮之类的，但我们的EnglishPod学习者，他们知道。

segments.en: Yeah, you'll sound really knowledgeable, really cool using that one.
segments.cn: 是的，使用这个词你会显得很有知识，真的很酷。

segments.en: And our last word today... travel.
When you walk with the basketball.
Well, technically you're allowed to take 2 steps in basketball.
segments.cn: 嗯，技术上讲，在篮球中你可以走两步。

segments.en: So when you take more than 2 steps, then it's traveling.
segments.cn: 所以当你走超过两步时，就是旅行。

segments.en: So yeah, traveling means to take more than 2 steps with the ball.
segments.cn: 所以是的，旅行意味着带着球走超过两步。

segments.en: Let's listen to the dialogue a second time.
This time it'll be a bit slower so that we can understand some of these great phrases we just talked about.
segments.cn: 这次会慢一点，以便我们能理解一些我们刚刚谈到的好短语。

segments.en: Jack always screws up free throws.
Yeah, that was a great shot.
He traveled and the ref didn't even call it.
segments.cn: 他走步了，裁判甚至没有吹哨。

segments.en: I can't believe he didn't see that.
segments.cn: 我真不敢相信他没看到。

segments.en: The end of the first quarter.
Hey, I'm gonna make a beer run.
Alright sports fans, so now let's take a look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 好吧，体育迷们，现在让我们看看流利度提升。

segments.en: Ok, today on Fluency Builder we have two really common words that you would listen to while you're watching a game.
segments.cn: 好的，今天在流利度提升中，我们有两个在观看比赛时会听到的常用词。

segments.en: Yeah, these are sort of slangy words, hey?
segments.cn: 是的，这些算是俚语词，对吧？

segments.en: The first one that we have is screw up.
Yeah, so this is a good way of saying to make a mistake.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一种说犯错误的好方式。

segments.en: Let's listen to some examples of how this word is used.
segments.cn: 让我们听听这个词的用法示例。

segments.en: I'm sorry, I know I screwed up.
segments.cn: 对不起，我知道我搞砸了。

segments.en: Ok, so screw up is mess up.
segments.cn: 好的，所以搞砸就是搞错。

segments.en: Great, and our last word on Fluency Builder today, a beer run.
segments.cn: 很好，今天流利度提升的最后一个词，买啤酒。

segments.en: So, what is this beer run?
segments.cn: 那么，这个买啤酒是什么？

segments.en: You go to the store and get beer.
So it's just an expression to meaning to go and get more beer.
segments.cn: 所以这只是一个表达，意思是去再买点啤酒。

segments.en: Yeah, usually you're watching a game or you're at home with your friends.
segments.cn: 是的，通常你是在看比赛或者和朋友在家。

segments.en: You run out of beer, so somebody has to go get some beer.
segments.cn: 你啤酒喝完了，所以有人得去买啤酒。

segments.en: Don't worry, Shaq always screws up free throws.
segments.cn: 别担心，沙奎尔总是搞砸罚球。

segments.en: You were right, he didn't make the shot.
Yeah, that was a great shot.
He traveled and the ref didn't even call it.
segments.cn: 他走步了，裁判甚至没有吹哨。

segments.en: Can't believe he didn't see that.
Ok, end of the first quarter.
Alright, I'm going to make a beer run.
Ok guys, I hope you enjoyed our lesson today.
segments.cn: 好的，大家，希望你们喜欢今天的课程。

segments.en: We'll be bringing you more sports lessons in the future.
segments.cn: 我们将来会带来更多的体育课程。

segments.en: So if you have a particular sport that you want to learn about, you can tell us.
segments.cn: 所以如果你有想学习的特定运动，可以告诉我们。

segments.en: Yeah, and leave us your comments or your suggestions or any doubts that you have.
segments.cn: 是的，给我们留言或建议，或者任何你有的疑问。

segments.en: And we're always there to answer it, so we'll see you there.
segments.cn: 我们总是在那里回答，所以我们会在那里见。
